channel.title: MP3 player
channel.description:
I'm thinking of buying a new MP3 player, and found the Philips GoGear SA5285BT/02 8GB. It should cost about €135. Here is the page about it: http://www.consumer.philips.com/consumer/en/gb/consumer/cc/_language_gb/_productid_SA5285BT_02_GB_CONSUMER
To be honest, I don't know much of this subject.
I want:
a MP3 player that will survive for a few years (at least 2) Has at least 2 GB storage Neat features, like a color screen and maybe even some sort of agenda/task planner (quite handy for school) Not more then €150 (If there are any Dutchies left here: can you look on http://tweakers.net/pricewatch for me?)
I know almost all current MP3 players fulfill my needs, but I want the best I can get for a small amount of money. I'm a student after all :cool:. So, to say it short: I want the best MP3 player I can get for €150.
Edit: Oh and, if possible, some sort of text/table support would be nice too. I'm always fooling around with the times my bus leaves, so having the schedule with me helps a lot.

item.title: MP3 player
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:15, topic:248058”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=327066.msg2563939#msg2563939 date=1228294487]
Now that I think about it, my own MP3 player doesn’t last longer then 11 hours. And all it has is a one line screen. And the reviewers thought 11 hours was short, but they only could load the battery via the pc. I already have a wall adapter, so I can charge it within 2-3 hours.

All in all, the zen x-fi is what I want, but I’m worried about the durability.
[/quote]
The front of the iPod is plastic, and the screen is certainly plastic. My advice to you is to take care of your belongings instead of treating them poorly and relying on their durability.[/quote]

The iPod Nano V4 is made of some metal IIRC.

Read full topic

And the reviewers thought 11 hours was short, but they only could load the battery via the pc. I already have a wall adapter, so I can charge it within 2-3 hours.

All in all, the zen x-fi is what I want, but I’m worried about the durability.[/quote]

item.title: MP3 player
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:2, topic:248058”]if you’re willing to spend 160 euro, get a creative zen x-fi, zen’s are win tbh
also, it’s 16 gb ;)[/quote]

This reviewer says it’s not that great: http://tweakers.net/pricewatch/reviews/222092/creative-zen-x-fi-16gb-zwart.html

I’m looking for some more reviews. I read some more reviews of the creative zen x-fi.

Cons:
The battery doesn’t last long (11 hours).
It’s made of plastic, so I’m worried about the durability of it.
For me: My current MP3 player has a neckcord, so I can wear it. This one doesn’t have a clip where I can attach a cord to.

Pros:
Quite a load of features
Wifi
cheap (€160 including transport)
Quality sound + EP-830 earplugs

I’m not sure what to do. I’ve heard an iPod Nano is quite good too. A classmate has one, and he likes it. It’s cheaper, but has less features. But it’s probably better quality, as its cover is made of metal and not plastic.

EDIT: why do you guys dislike iPod’s? I’m not saying I like them, I’m just wondering.

Read full topic
